documentation:
Yarn is the Dogen meta-model.

@section coding_0 Overview

Coding is a meta-model that provides a programming-language-neutral type
representation, designed for code generation. There are two core types
in coding: @e endomodel and @e model. Intermediate models are
obtained via @frontends and post-processed until they form a cohesive
whole. They are then transformed into a final model representation, at
which point they are suitable for code generation.

@section coding_0 Mission

Coding's objectives are:

@li to provide a set of constructs that the frontends can map to
easily, as well as the machinery for frontend management
(registration, etc.).

@li to provide the tooling required to combine multiple intermediate
coding models together into a bigger model - called the intermediate @e
merged model.

@li to ensure the consistency of the intermediate merged model via
validation rules (such as verifying that all types have a definitions,
etc.).

@li to provide all the information required to build the final model
and to build it.

elements.name: meta_model::attribute
elements.documentation: Represents an attribute in an object.

attributes.name: unparsed_type
attributes.documentation:
Original type name as it appeared in the source, without any parsing.

Name must be in one of the supported notations.

attributes.name: parsed_type
attributes.documentation: Tree of names that represent the type of the attribute, after suitable parsing.

attributes.name: is_immutable
attributes.documentation: If true, the attribute can only be read but not set.

attributes.name: is_fluent
attributes.documentation: If true, the attribute's setter will return the object iteself.

elements.name: meta_model::name_tree
elements.documentation:
Adds support for name composition as a tree-like structure.

A name tree has the responsibility of representing an instantiation of a generic
type with all of its type parameters, which themselves can also be generic types
and so on. It may also represent the simpler case of a non-generic type, in which
case only the parent name is populated and there are no children.

attributes.name: current
attributes.documentation: Name for the current level of the tree.

attributes.name: children
attributes.documentation: Names of the child elements.

attributes.name: are_children_opaque
attributes.documentation:
If true, the association with its children can be opaque.

Children are considered opaque when the parent does not require knowledge
about the childs' internal structure. This is the case, for example, with C and
C++ pointers, references and so on.

attributes.name: is_circular_dependency
attributes.documentation: If true, the presence of the current name causes a circular dependency.

attributes.name: qualified
attributes.documentation: Qualified name in a language specific representation.

attributes.name: identifiable
attributes.documentation:
Representation of the named tree that can usable as an identifier across all
supported languages.

attributes.name: is_current_simple_type
attributes.documentation: Returns true if @e current is a simple type such as a built-in or an enumeration.

attributes.name: is_floating_point
attributes.documentation: If true, "current" stores a floating point type.

elements.name: meta_model::element
elements.documentation:
Represents a generic coding construct.

An element is anything of interest in a problem domain which needs to be
expressed in code generation. It covers both types (objects, enumerations, etc),
meta-types (object templates) and non-types (modules and backend specific entities).

attributes.name: is_element_extension
attributes.documentation: If true, this element extends another element with the same id.

attributes.name: opaque_properties
attributes.documentation:
Any opaque properties associated with this element, by key.

The key is expected to be namespaced by owning model name, to avoid
clashes.

elements.name: meta_model::module
elements.documentation:
Container for other coding elements.

Aggregates a group of logically related elements into a unit.

attributes.name: members
attributes.documentation: All the model elements contained in this module.

attributes.name: is_root
attributes.documentation: If true, this module is thee root module of the model.

attributes.name: is_global_module
attributes.documentation: If true, this module is the pseudo module that models the global namespace.

elements.name: meta_model::object_template
elements.documentation: Represents a structural template for yarn objects.

attributes.name: parents
attributes.documentation: List of object templates that this object template inherits from, if any.

attributes.name: is_child
attributes.documentation: If true, the object template has at least one parent.

elements.name: meta_model::Nameable
elements.documentation: Ability to have a name.

attributes.name: name
attributes.documentation: Fully qualified name.

elements.name: meta_model::Documentable
elements.documentation: Ability to provide documentation.

attributes.name: documentation
attributes.documentation:
Code comments.

These are expected to follow the grammar of the comment processing tools
of the programming language in question, e.g. Doxygen for C++, JavaDoc
for Java, etc.

elements.name: meta_model::Annotatable
elements.documentation: Ability to have meta-data associated.

attributes.name: annotation
attributes.documentation: Annotation for this element.

elements.name: meta_model::DeterminableOrigin
elements.documentation: A unit of coding that can be code generated.

attributes.name: origin_type
attributes.documentation: How was this model element originated.

elements.name: meta_model::Containable
elements.documentation: The ability to be contained inside a module.

attributes.name: contained_by
attributes.documentation: Name of the module in which we are contained.

attributes.name: in_global_module
attributes.documentation: If true, the element is located in the global module.

attributes.name: static_stereotypes
attributes.documentation:
Stereotypes that are part of the dogen UML profile, and so are well-known to the
model.

attributes.name: dynamic_stereotypes
attributes.documentation: Stereotypes that are not part of the yarn UML profile. These are user defined.

attributes.name: meta_name
attributes.documentation: Name of the element in the meta-model that this instance conforms to.

elements.name: meta_model::Element
elements.documentation:
A unit of coding that can be code generated.

We define the Element object template purely to make our life easier
when creating the element class. It is not required for any other
purpose.

elements.name: meta_model::builtin
elements.documentation: Represents a value type that is built-in at the hardware level.

attributes.name: is_default_enumeration_type
attributes.documentation: If true, this built-in is the default type to be used on enumerations.

attributes.name: is_floating_point
attributes.documentation: If true, this built-in represents a floating point number.

attributes.name: can_be_enumeration_underlier
attributes.documentation: If true, this element can be the underlying element of an enumeration.

attributes.name: can_be_primitive_underlier
attributes.documentation: If true, this built-in can be the underlying element of a primitive.

elements.name: meta_model::enumeration
elements.documentation:
Defines a bounded set of logically related values for a built-in type
or a string.

attributes.name: underlying_element
attributes.documentation: Underlying element of each instance of the enumeration.

attributes.name: enumerators
attributes.documentation: Enumerators for this enumeration.

attributes.name: use_implementation_defined_underlying_element
attributes.documentation: If true, we will use the implementation specific default enumeration type.

attributes.name: use_implementation_defined_enumerator_values
attributes.documentation: If true, we will rely on compiler generated enumeration values.

attributes.name: add_invalid_enumerator
attributes.documentation: If true, an enumerator for "invalid" will be added.

elements.name: meta_model::enumerator
elements.documentation:
One of a set of valid values that an enumeration can assume.

The enumerator defines an element in the domain of the enumeration.

attributes.name: value
attributes.documentation:
Value for the enumerator.

It must be castable to instance of the type defined in the enumeration.

elements.name: meta_model::object
elements.documentation:
Representation of the class notion in the OOP paradigm.

The @e object is equivalent to a meta-class, but we decided against this
name because all elements should also have the prefix meta - after all, yarn is a
meta-model. Since the word class cannot be used in c++ to name types, we
decided instead to use the word object.

attributes.name: is_associative_container
attributes.documentation: Object is an associative container.

attributes.name: object_templates
attributes.documentation: All object templates associated with this object.

attributes.name: associative_container_keys
attributes.documentation: Elements that are keys in an associative container.

attributes.name: provides_opaqueness
attributes.documentation: If true, this type provides opaqueness to any type parameters it may have.

attributes.name: can_be_primitive_underlier
attributes.documentation: If true, this object can be the underlying element of a primitive.

elements.name: meta_model::name
elements.documentation:
Name of an element in coding space.

A name represents a point in coding space, and this point can only be
used by one coding element. Names can be uniquely identified by their
qualified ID.

Name has the following properties: a) two different points in element space
cannot have the same name and b) the same point in element space can only
have one and only one name.

Names are required in addition to just using the qualfied ID representation
because we use them to infer all sorts of properties for an element (namespaces,
naming files, etc).

attributes.name: id
attributes.documentation:
Unique identifier representation for this name, using a well-defined notation.

Note that the qualified ID itself should not be part of the address, but it is
placed here as an optimisation. The ID is a bijective function on the address,
but designed not to have the ability to split out its constituent parts. The ID
is generated by combining all the constituents of the address, including the
location (but not the ID itself, of course).

attributes.name: simple
attributes.documentation:
Simple (non-qualified) name of the coding element at this address.

The simple name must be unique for a given location.

attributes.name: qualified
attributes.documentation: Qualified name in a language specific representation.

attributes.name: location
attributes.documentation: Where the name is located in element space.

attributes.name: identifiable
attributes.documentation:
Representation of the name that can usable as an identifier on all of the supported
languages, using the entire name structure.

elements.name: meta_model::origin_types
elements.documentation: What originated the model element.

attributes.name: target
attributes.documentation: The element is part of the target model.

attributes.name: proxy_reference
attributes.documentation:
The element was part of a reference model which is a proxy model.

Proxy models expose types from existing code such as STL, boost, etc,
providing a way to expose third party code into Dogen so that we
can make use of these types.

attributes.name: non_proxy_reference
attributes.documentation: The element was part of a reference model which is regular dogen model.

attributes.name: not_yet_determined
attributes.documentation: The origin of the element is not yet known

elements.name: meta_model::Stateful
elements.documentation: Ability to have a state.

attributes.name: all_attributes
local_attributes
attributes.documentation: The set of all attributes directly associated with the type.

attributes.name: inherited_attributes
attributes.documentation:
The set of all attributes obtained via inheritance, by parent name.

Note that we are using name as a key by design (instead of id); it is required for
formatting.

attributes.name: is_immutable
attributes.documentation: If true, do not generate setters for the element's attributes.

attributes.name: is_fluent
attributes.documentation: If true, generate fluent setters.

elements.name: meta_model::location
elements.documentation:
Identifies a hierarchy of containment within the coding space.

Elements exist at unique points within the coding space called @e addresses.
However, certain elements have the ability to contain other elements, creating
in effect new dimensions in coding space. The location class keeps track
of these dimensions. Note that the attributes of this class are hierarchical, i.e.
external modules contain model modules and so forth. These attributes are best
thought of as a single linked list, where segments of that linked list have different
meaning. However, because we care about these meanings, we implemented the
type with a number of linked lists, one per meaning.

A location is not necessarily connected to modules, although these are the main
model elements that provide containment. For example, inner classes are
contained within classes; in coding terms it means a location should also have an
"object" attribute to represent this relationship.

Also, note that the location class itself encodes the address of the element that
owns that location; returning to the linked list idea, the tail of the linked list is
the name of the element, and the remaining linked list provides the location of
the element.

attributes.name: external_modules
attributes.documentation:
All modules external to the model itself.

It is sometimes useful to create a model within a set of existing modules. In this
case, the model does not own the existing modules and they are considered
"external" to the model. This is useful, for example, when declaring a model
within a larger project such as @e masd::masd::coding. In this case, @e dogen is the
external module.

attributes.name: model_modules
internal_modules
attributes.documentation: Sub-modules within a model.

attributes.name: element
attributes.documentation:
Name of the owning element, if any.

For coding elements which are located within other coding elements that
are not modules, such as attributes, inner classes, etc.

elements.name: meta_model::model
elements.documentation: Coding model.

attributes.name: references
attributes.documentation: All other models that this model depends on, mapped to their origin.

attributes.name: leaves
attributes.documentation:
All leaf types in this endomodel.

Leaves are types concrete types which have a parent.

attributes.name: root_module
attributes.documentation: The module that represents the model.

attributes.name: module_ids
attributes.documentation: IDs of all of the model elements which are modules.

attributes.name: has_generatable_types
attributes.documentation: If true the intermediate model has at least one generable type, false otherwise.

attributes.name: input_language
attributes.documentation: Language in which this model was written.

attributes.name: output_language
attributes.documentation: Language in which to output the model.

elements.name: meta_model::endomodel
elements.documentation: Intermediate representation of a yarn model.

attributes.name: references
attributes.documentation:
All other intermediate models that this endomodel depends on, mapped to their
origin.

attributes.name: leaves
attributes.documentation:
All leaf types in this endomodel.

Leaves are types concrete types which have a parent.

attributes.name: modules
attributes.documentation: Modules contained in the endomodel.

attributes.name: object_templates
attributes.documentation: All the object templates available in this endomodel.

attributes.name: builtins
attributes.documentation: All built-ins contained in this endomodel.

attributes.name: enumerations
attributes.documentation: All enumerations contained in this endomodel.

attributes.name: primitives
attributes.documentation: All primitives in this endomodel.

attributes.name: objects
attributes.documentation: All objects contained in this endomodel.

attributes.name: exceptions
attributes.documentation: All exceptions in this endomodel.

attributes.name: visitors
attributes.documentation: All visitors in this endomodel.

attributes.name: input_language
attributes.documentation: Language in which this endomodel was written.

attributes.name: output_languages
attributes.documentation: Languages in which to output the final model.

elements.name: meta_model::Visitable
elements.documentation: The ability to handle visitation.

attributes.name: base_visitor
attributes.documentation: Base class of the visitor that visits the current element, if any.

attributes.name: derived_visitor
attributes.documentation: Derived class of the visitor that visits the current element, if any.

elements.name: meta_model::Associatable
elements.documentation: The element has the ability to associate itself with other elements.

attributes.name: transparent_associations
attributes.documentation: Elements that are involved in aggregation or composition relationships.

attributes.name: opaque_associations
attributes.documentation:
Elements that are involved in aggregation or composition relationships via
indirection.

This is used to break cycles where required.

elements.name: meta_model::Generalizable
elements.documentation: The element has the ability to be part of a generalization relationship.

attributes.name: is_parent
attributes.documentation: True if this element is the parent of one or more elements, false otherwise.

attributes.name: is_child
attributes.documentation: If true, the element has at least one parent.

attributes.name: is_leaf
attributes.documentation: True if the type has a parent but no children.

attributes.name: is_final
attributes.documentation: If true, the element cannot be inherited from.

attributes.name: is_abstract
attributes.documentation: If true, the type is an abstract type.

attributes.name: in_inheritance_relationship
attributes.documentation: True if the object is related to at least one other object as a parent or a child.

attributes.name: root_parents
attributes.documentation: Top-most parents at the root of the inheritance hierarchy, if any.

attributes.name: parents
attributes.documentation: Direct parent of this element, if any.

attributes.name: leaves
attributes.documentation: Elements that are at the bottom of the inheritance tree.

elements.name: meta_model::Relatable
elements.documentation: Element has the ability to have relationships with other elements.

elements.name: meta_model::visitor
elements.documentation: Represents a visitor in the GOF visitor design pattern.

attributes.name: visits
attributes.documentation: Elements that are visitable by the visitor.

elements.name: meta_model::exception
elements.documentation: Represents an exception which can be thrown.

elements.name: meta_model::languages
elements.documentation: Models need to declare upfront the programming language they will target.

elements.name: meta_model::primitive
elements.documentation: Defines an element created by the user to wrap another element, most likely a built-in.

attributes.name: is_nullable
attributes.documentation: If true, this element can be null (empty).

attributes.name: value_attribute
attributes.documentation: Attribute that represents the value of the primitive.

attributes.name: use_type_aliasing
attributes.documentation: If true and if the programming language supports it, it uses type aliases

attributes.name: is_immutable
attributes.documentation: If true, do not generate a setter..

attributes.name: generate_mapping
attributes.documentation: If true, object-relational mapping will be generated for this element.

attributes.name: schema_name
attributes.documentation: Name of the database schema in which to place this element.

attributes.name: table_name
attributes.documentation: Name of the table to map this element to.

attributes.name: is_value
attributes.documentation: If true, treat this object as a value type (e.g. simple type) rather than as an object.

attributes.name: has_primary_key
attributes.documentation: True if the object has an attribute marked as a primary key, false otherwise.

attributes.name: letter_case
attributes.documentation: What case to use for the database identifiers.

attributes.name: column_name
attributes.documentation: Name of the column to use for this attribute. If populated, will override the attribute name.

attributes.name: is_primary_key
attributes.documentation: If true, this attribute is a primary key for the relation.

attributes.name: is_nullable
attributes.documentation: If true, the attribute can be NULL.

attributes.name: type_overrides
attributes.documentation: Override the default type for this attribute for a given database system.

attributes.name: is_composite
attributes.documentation: If true, the value of this attribute is a composite value.

attributes.name: schema_name
attributes.documentation: Name of the database schema in which elements contained by this module will placed in.

attributes.name: generate_mapping
attributes.documentation: If true, object-relational mapping will be generated for this element.

attributes.name: schema_name
attributes.documentation: Name of the database schema in which to place this element.

attributes.name: letter_case
attributes.documentation: What case to use for the database identifiers.

elements.name: transforms::transformation_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred whilst applying a transformation.

elements.name: helpers::validation_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred during validation.

elements.name: helpers::indexing_error
elements.documentation: A fatal error has occurred while indexing.

elements.name: helpers::resolution_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred while trying to resolve a type.

elements.name: helpers::mapping_error
elements.documentation: An error has occurred while mapping element names.

elements.name: helpers::mapping_set
elements.documentation:
Consistent unit of mapping that can be used to translate a model from a language to
another.

elements.name: helpers::mapping_set_repository
elements.documentation: Stores all available mapping sets.

elements.name: helpers::mapping
elements.documentation: Stores the mapping of a key (the element id) to its values, organised by language.

attributes.name: lam_id
attributes.documentation: Language agnostic ID of the element we're mapping from.

attributes.name: by_language
attributes.documentation: Values of the mapping, by language.

elements.name: helpers::mapping_value
elements.documentation: Value of a mapping.

elements.name: helpers::printing_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred whilst pretty printing.

elements.name: helpers::separators
elements.documentation: Available separators to be used by the pretty printer.

attributes.name: angle_brackets
attributes.documentation: Enclose name elements in '<' and '>'.

attributes.name: double_colons
attributes.documentation: Separate name elements with a '::'.

attributes.name: dots
attributes.documentation: Separate name elements with a '.'.

elements.name: helpers::node
elements.documentation:
Node in a tree of names.

Temporary data structure used to build trees of names.

attributes.name: parent
attributes.documentation: Parent in a tree.

attributes.name: data
attributes.documentation: Current node.

attributes.name: children
attributes.documentation: Child nodes in a tree.

elements.name: helpers::building_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred whilst building.

elements.name: helpers::parsing_error
elements.documentation: A fatal error has occurred while parsing.

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.documentation: If true, this facet is enabled.

attributes.name: directory
attributes.documentation: Directory in which to place artefacts that belong to this facet.

attributes.name: postfix
attributes.documentation: Postfix to use in file names of artefacts that belong to this facet.

attributes.name: log_file
attributes.documentation: Full path to the log file.

attributes.name: log_level
attributes.documentation: What level of logging to log at.

attributes.name: target
attributes.documentation: Full path to the model to generate.

attributes.name: delete_extra_files
attributes.documentation: Delete any extra files found in managed directories.

attributes.name: force_write
attributes.documentation: Always generate files even if there are no differences with existing file.

attributes.name: ignore_patterns
attributes.documentation: List of regular expressions to filter out files to ignore.

attributes.name: output_directory_path
attributes.documentation: Full path to the directory in which to place the generated code.

attributes.name: cpp_headers_output_directory_path
attributes.documentation: If set, all c++ include files will be placed at this location.

attributes.name: compatibility_mode
attributes.documentation:
Try to process diagram even if there are errors.

Only a certain class of errors are allowed, believed to be caused by backwards or
forwards compatibility problems: missing types or types that do not exist.

attributes.name: probe_stats
attributes.documentation: Enable tracing for statistics around transforms.

attributes.name: probe_stats_disable_guids
attributes.documentation: Disable guids in probe stats, to make comparisons easier.

attributes.name: probe_stats_org_mode
attributes.documentation: Output the stats as an org-mode document.

attributes.name: probe_all
attributes.documentation: Enable all tracing.

attributes.name: probe_directory
attributes.documentation: Full path to the directory in which to place probe information.

attributes.name: probe_use_short_names
attributes.documentation:
Use short directory and file names. Useful mainly on windows due to path
size limitations.

elements.name: transforms::validation_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred when validating options.

attributes.name: name_separator
attributes.documentation: Separator to use when concatenating sub-components of a path component.

attributes.name: force_backend_directory
attributes.documentation:
If true, the backend directory will be expressed, even when there is only one
backend enabled.

attributes.name: disable_facet_directories
attributes.documentation: If true, directories for facets are not generated.

attributes.name: structured
attributes.documentation: Create the standard directory structure.

attributes.name: completely_flat
attributes.documentation: Suppress the generation of all directories.

attributes.name: flatten_facets
attributes.documentation: Flatten only the facets but preserve remaining structure.

elements.name: meta_model::model_segment_properties
elements.documentation: Properties related to the model segment of the path.

attributes.name: directory
attributes.documentation:
If supplied, the override directory name will take precedence and all other
settings will be ignored.

If not supplied the model path segment is computed from the remaining settings.

attributes.name: external_modules
attributes.documentation: What kind of contribution do the external modules make to the final path.

attributes.name: model_modules
attributes.documentation: What kind of contribution do the model modules make to the final path.

elements.name: meta_model::path_contribution_types
elements.documentation: Different kinds of contributions that can be made to the final path computation.

attributes.name: none
attributes.documentation: The item does not contribute at all to the path.

attributes.name: as_folders
attributes.documentation: The itemcontributes folders to the path.

attributes.name: as_path_components
attributes.documentation: The item contributes a single folder to the path, as a delimited string.

elements.name: meta_model::backend_properties
elements.documentation: Properties related to the backend.

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.documentation: If true, this backend is enabled.

attributes.name: directory
attributes.documentation: Backend specific directory name, if any.

attributes.name: override_parent_path
attributes.documentation:
If supplied, this path is used as the parent path instead of the output path.

This is useful for example when you want to place the include files outside of the
model directory.

attributes.name: path_segment
attributes.documentation: Path segment to use for this intra-backend segment.

attributes.name: external_modules
attributes.documentation: What kind of contribution do the external modules make to the final path.

attributes.name: model_modules
attributes.documentation: What kind of contribution do the model modules make to the final path.

attributes.name: internal_modules
attributes.documentation: What kind of contribution do the internal modules make to the final path.

attributes.name: facet
attributes.documentation: What kind of contribution does the facet make to the final path.

elements.name: meta_model::archetype_family_properties
elements.documentation: Properties pertaining to families of archetypes, related to the path computation.

attributes.name: extension
attributes.documentation: Extension to use for files of this group. Includes the leading dot.

elements.name: meta_model::archetype_properties
elements.documentation: Archetype level properties, applicable to all instances of this archetype.

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.documentation: If false, will disable all instances of this archetype.

attributes.name: postfix
attributes.documentation: Postfix to use for artefacts of this archetype.

elements.name: transforms::building_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred whilst the factory was building.

elements.name: meta_model::artefact
elements.documentation: Artefact in a text model.

attributes.name: path
attributes.documentation: Absolute path to the file, indicating the location in the filesystem where it will be written.

attributes.name: content
attributes.documentation: Content of the file.

attributes.name: overwrite
attributes.documentation:
Determines when to write the file.

If true, the file will always be written to the filesystem; if false, the file will
only be written to the filesystem if it does not exist.

attributes.name: dependencies
attributes.documentation: Files in the project directory that this file depends on, but which are not generated.

elements.name: helpers::writing_error
elements.documentation: An error ocrurred whilst writing.

elements.name: meta_model::static_stereotypes
elements.documentation: Lists all stereotypes defined in the yarn UML profile.

elements.name: helpers::stereotypes_conversion_result
elements.documentation:
Aggregates the result of parsing a CSV string with well-known stereotypes and user
defined stereotypes.

elements.name: meta_model::opaque_properties
elements.documentation: Base class for any properties that are not known to coding.

elements.name: meta_model::fake_opaque_properties
elements.documentation: Temporary class used only to trigger inheritance generation.
